byline.contributor: Stephen Castle reported from Leeds, and Pauline Bock from London. Steven Erlanger and Stephen Farrell contributed reporting from London, and Christopher Mele from New York.
byline.original: By STEPHEN CASTLE and PAULINE BOCK

abstract: British Member of Parliament Jo Cox is fatally shot while meeting with constituents outside Leeds, England; police arrest Thomas Mair, who is suspected of links to white supremacist groups and had history of mental illness; rare incident of gun violence comes days ahead of national referendum on remaining in European Union, and prompts suspension of campaigns on both sides.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Cox, a Labour lawmaker representing Batley and Spen in northern England, died after being shot outside a library in her district.

headline.main: Jo Cox, Member of British Parliament, Is Killed in Attack
headline.print_headline: A ‘Star’ of British Politics Is Killed; E.U. Campaign Is Suspended

snippet: Ms. Cox, a Labour lawmaker representing Batley and Spen in northern England, died after being shot outside a library in her district.
